name: vestigially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that has almost disappeared, or that is a small remaining part of something: He failed to show the battlefield bravery that is vestigially expected of men. The British Empire now exists only vestigially. See
vestigial
More examplesFewer examplesThe emotional connection of his best work was only vestigially evident.The practice persisted until at least 1400, and vestigially for much longer still.The two companies are only vestigially related these days.
